result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy L. Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy L. Schmidt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy L. Schmidt in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant and reviews chg and pens; no contest plea is entered; Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty; parties heard; defendant waives statement; Court heard; sentence is imposed:

costs w/i 1 year
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

1:30 - Defendant Jeremy L. Schmidt in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held. Atty Vollan requests P&S date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:00 - Defendant Jeremy L. Schmidt in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Atty Vollan updates address to DCJ. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Return date scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.
